exam_papers.title: 2022年6月大学英语四级考试真题（一）
exam_papers.description: 2022年6月大学英语四级考试真题（第一套），包含写作、听力、阅读理解和翻译四个部分

exam_sections.directions: Suppose you are going to write a proposal to your school library for improving its service. You are to write about its current problems and possible solutions to these problems. You will have 30 minutes to write the proposal. You should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.

In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage. Read the passage through carefully before making your choices. Each choice in the bank is identified by a letter. Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre. You may not use any of the words in the bank more than once.
exam_sections.passage_content:
You might think of your teeth as tools, like built-in knives and forks, but if they are mere tools, why do they feel pain and wouldn't it be better if they could just ______ under any condition? In spite of our ______ discomfort, it turns out there's a good reason our teeth are so sensitive. Tooth pain is a ______ mechanism that ensures when a tooth is being damaged we'll notice and do something about it.

If we eat something too hot or too cold, or if the tooth is worn down enough where the tissue ______ is exposed, all of those things cause pain, and then the pain causes the person not to use that tooth to try to protect it a little bit more. So it's really a protective mechanism more than anything else. If teeth didn't feel pain, we might ______ to use them in situations that damage them, and for humans, damaging ______ teeth is a problem because, unlike crocodiles, we can't ______ them.

Teeth have three layers, only one of which—the innermost layer of the tooth—can hurt, as that layer of the tooth ______ both blood vessels and nerves. Pain is the only feeling to which the nerves in that layer respond. Whereas people with tooth sensitivity may complain, for example, of tooth pain ______ by heat or cold, the nerves in the inner layer don't sense temperature. Rather, they feel pain, which may be ______ with, say, drinking something very cold.
exam_sections.passage_title: Why are teeth so sensitive to pain?

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived. You may choose a paragraph more than once. Each paragraph is marked with a letter. Answer the questions by marking the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.passage_content:
A. On paper, the job seemed perfect for me: The position was completely in line with my degree, the duties and responsibilities were compatible with my interests, and the office maintained a well-stocked kitchen that would satisfy my every snack desire.

B. Sounds like my dream job, right? There was only one small problem: I simply didn't get along with the company culture. They favored a more rigid, closed-door, corporate atmosphere, while I would have preferred something more collaborative and open. They were complete clock watchers, while I would have liked a more flexible schedule. To put it plainly, we just weren't on the same page.

C. When it comes to looking for a new job, you already know that a big part of the interview process involves the company evaluating whether or not you're a good fit for their open role. But, it's important to keep in mind that the employer isn't the only one who needs to identify a good match—you should be looking for that same exact thing. Company culture can have a big impact on how you feel about your work, so you want to make sure you sign an offer letter with an organization you're truly excited about.

D. However, figuring out what a company is like before you actually work there can be a bit of a challenge. Luckily, there are a few things you can do to determine whether or not a company is a good fit for you—before you ever sign your name on that dotted line.

E. First of all, know what you want. It's hard to make any decisions when you don't really know what you're looking for. So before you can determine whether you and a specific company would be compatible together, it's important to have a solid handle on what exactly you want from your employer. Many of us have an easier time identifying the things that we absolutely don't want. If those are the only things you can think of, don't worry! That's still a good place to start.

F. Start by writing down the things you didn't like about previous employers, as well as the parts you really valued. There's no wrong answer here—so from big things to small details, write them all down on your list. This will help you immediately identify what you're looking for in an organization, as well as the things you're trying to stay far, far away from.

G. Make sure to do your research. Now comes the part when you put on your detective hat and do a little digging. The Internet will be your best friend when you're trying to familiarize yourself with a company's culture before ever walking through their office doors. And where exactly should you look for these culture clues? Start with the most obvious place first; the company's website. Read through their copy and blog. Do they use formal, direct language? Or is it casual, conversational, and maybe even a little humorous? This can be a big indicator of what sort of atmosphere the company is trying to cultivate.

H. Next, turn your attention toward their social media outlets. Are they sharing photos of their team's Thursday afternoon barbeque or Halloween costume contest? Or are their social media accounts strictly reserved for company-related announcements and product launches?

I. An industry review website like Glassdoor is another spot to check in order to find some insider information about what you can expect about a company. However, remember to take the reviews you read with a grain of salt—many of them are written by scorned employees.

J. Finally, you can never fail with personal connections. Send a quick message to a current or previous company employee on LinkedIn or by email and ask if they would be willing to have a quick conversation with you about the organization in general. If you get a yes to your request for a chat, you'll be armed with some pretty powerful and helpful information heading into your interview!

K. Learn more by asking questions. You know that part at the end of a job interview when the hiring manager asks if you have any questions, and you just stare across the table blankly with your mouth hanging open? That's the perfect opportunity to speak up and get your burning company culture questions answered! So yes, you can definitely ask your interviewer about what it's like to work for that particular organization. Simple questions like, "What three words would you use to describe the culture here?" or "What's your favorite part about working for this company?" can reveal a lot about what it's really like behind closed doors.

L. Prioritize your values. What does my dream company culture look like? Well, I could come and go as I please, as long as I was getting the work done. My boss would genuinely listen to and value all of my ideas and suggestions. My co-workers would all be friendly with one another, without ever falling into the office gossip trap. The kitchen would have endless options of pizza and cookies. Oh, and they'd give me two months of paid vacation with a very generous salary.

M. What are my chances of finding all of those things with one employer? Slim to none—believe me, I've looked. This is why it's so important to know which aspects of a company's culture you value most. Is it an open communication style or a flexible schedule? Focus on the top spots on your priority list, and ensure a potential employer at least checks those boxes. Unfortunately, this is reality, you can't have everything you want but a few are certainly achievable.

N. When you're hunting for a new job, you already know that the employer is trying to decide whether or not you're a good fit for the position. But you should also look at the process through a similar lens. You may not be the one conducting the actual interview, but you're still trying to determine whether or not the company is a good fit for you.

O. Keep these tips in mind to figure out whether you and a potential employer are a perfect match or just a recipe for disaster. After all, it's a good thing to know before actually accepting an offer.
exam_sections.passage_title: How to determine if a company is a good fit for you

exam_sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C) and D). You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Passage One

Online classes began to be popularized just a few decades ago. They are advertised as a way for adults to finish their education and students to learn the material at their own pace—it is far more compatible for people with busy schedules.

But after being enrolled in an online course last fall semester, I came to realize online classes were merely a means to fulfil course requirements.

First of all, students lack the desire to learn, and they simply complete their assignments to receive credit for a passing grade rather than genuinely engage with the course material.

As online courses tend to have more than 100 students, most of the assignments are short and simple. They are not designed for students to interact with the material in depth but designed to be graded easily to accommodate such a large number of students.

Perhaps the biggest disadvantage of taking an online class is the absence of face-to-face interaction between the teacher and their students. Live sessions are infrequent and are often scheduled during the middle of the day when students have to attend other classes or work. The office hours of the professor may also be during inconvenient times for many students as well. Most interaction with the professor has to be through email which is often impersonal. It is nearly impossible for students to build a relationship with their professor.

There is also little interaction amongst students. It can be harder for students to create study groups and form relationships with their peers.

Online classes also require either a computer or laptop and a reliable internet connection. Not all students have access to these types of resources, whether it is for financial or other reasons, and some students can be put at a disadvantage.

Offering online classes certainly helps students who would otherwise not be able to attend classroom sessions. However, they fail to provide a genuine education with an emphasis on convenience rather than critical thinking. We need restructured online classes in which students can have a learning experience that will actually provide quality education.

Passage Two

In the age of the internet, there's no such thing as a private debate. But is that bad for science? Some scientists have had concerns. When debates in any sector move beyond the halls of universities and government agencies, there's potential for information to be used incorrectly, leading to public confusion; yet, open debate can also promote communication between the scientific community and the public. Recent open debates on scientific research, health, and policy have aroused greater public attention and encouraged more diverse voices. If this trend spurs scientists to agree more quickly about the best solutions to our problems—and at the same time helps the public observe the process of scientific discourse more clearly—then this is good for everyone, including scientists.

A recent debate published in The New York Times discussed the question of how quickly medicine should be developed and produced. Issues such as safety of the product and perception of the public were examined and considered. But some experts worried that such public speculation might lead people to believe that disagreement about the details meant a lack of adequate scientific consensus over the safety and efficiency of modern-day medicine.

The anxiety seems misplaced. Gone are the days of going to a conference and debating scientific issues, and that's good because those gatherings were not diverse enough and excluded many important voices. These days, the public can access debates about science regardless of where they take place.

For many scientists, public debate is a new frontier and it may feel like a place with few restraints or rules, but rather than avoiding such conversations, let the debates be transparent and vigorous, wherever they are held. If the public is to understand that science is an honorably self-correcting process, the idea that science is a fixed set of facts in a textbook needs to be dismissed. With the validity of science coming under attack, there's a need for scientific debates to be perceived as open and true to life. Let everyone see the noisy, messy deliberations that advance science and lead to decisions that benefit us all.

exam_sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.translation_content:
从前有个农夫嫌他种的禾苗长得慢，就到地里把禾苗一株株地拔高了一点。回家后他对家人说："今天可真把我累坏了！但我总算让禾苗一下子长高了。"他儿子到地里去一看，禾苗都已死光了。

现在有些家长急于让孩子成功，往往步那个农夫的后尘，搞得孩子苦不堪言，却不见孩子学业长进。这样的家长是否该对这个问题有所醒悟，让孩子自然成长呢？
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write a proposal to your school library for improving its service, including current problems and possible solutions.
exam_questions.analysis: 写作题目，需要学生写一份关于改进图书馆服务的建议书，包括当前问题和可能的解决方案
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的建议书写作能力，包括问题分析、解决方案提出和语言表达能力

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the new study from the news report?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It studied the effects of exercise on sleep.", "B) Its participants came from various walks of life.", "C) Its findings confirmed those of previous studies.", "D) It ran for as long as some thirty years."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻开头提到，在一项新研究中，其研究对象被随访了大约三十年。由此可知，这项研究进行了大约三十年。因此，答案为D)。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'They were followed for approximately three decades.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the news report say about beverages containing added sugar?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Eating more vegetables instead of meats.", "B) Drinking water instead of beverages with added sugar.", "C) Consuming more energy drinks and sports drinks.", "D) Forming the habit of exercising regularly."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻中提到，科学家表示他们的研究结果支持限制含糖饮料，我们应该用其他饮料代替它们，水是最好的选择。因此，答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'The scientists say that their results support limiting beverages with added sugar. They argue we should replace them with other drinks, with water being the best choice.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did German police say about a 64-year-old man?
exam_questions.options: ["A) He asked them about his lost paintings.", "B) He knew the owner of two missing paintings.", "C) He left his paintings at a highway rest stop.", "D) He found two 17th-century oil paintings."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。新闻开头提到，德国警方于周五发出呼吁，征求有关两幅17世纪的油画可能的所有者的信息。一名64岁的男子上个月在高速公路休息站的垃圾堆中发现了这两幅画作。由此推断，这位64岁的男子发现了两幅17世纪的油画。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'German police appealed Friday for information about the possible owners of two 17th-century oil paintings. Police said a 64-year-old man found the paintings in a garbage pile at a highway rest stop last month.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did an art expert conclude about the two paintings?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are imitations.", "B) They are originals.", "C) They were stolen by an Italian boy.", "D) They came from the same artist."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻中提到，一位艺术专家的初步评估得出结论，这两幅带框的画作是原作。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'An initial assessment by an art expert concluded the two framed paintings were originals, police said.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did the four-year-old girl attempt to do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Look after her grandfather.", "B) Leave the remote cold region.", "C) Save her sick grandmother.", "D) Flee from the threat of bears."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻开头提到，一个四岁的女孩步行八千米穿过一片白雪皑皑的森林，为她生病的祖母寻求帮助。由此可知，这位小女孩是想救她生病的祖母。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'A four-year-old girl has walked eight kilometers through a snowy forest to seek help for her sick grandmother who later died of a heart attack.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the news report about the girl's mother?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She has to face a criminal charge.", "B) She was found lying motionless in the snow.", "C) She searched for her daughter in freezing cold.", "D) She works in childcare services."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻中提到，那位女孩的母亲将会面临刑事指控。她被指控把一名未成年人留给老人照顾，将其置于危险之中。因此，答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'As a result, the girl's mother is facing a criminal case. She stands accused of leaving a minor in danger in the care of the elderly.'

exam_questions.question_text: What happened to the little girl according to the news report?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She was found in a forest after three days.", "B) She lay totally unconscious for three days.", "C) She suffered from the effects of severe cold.", "D) She was finally rescued by her relatives."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。新闻中提到，虽然女孩正遭受极寒所带来的影响，但据报道她没有生命危险。因此，答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'But though she was suffering from the effects of extreme cold, the child reportedly suffered no life-threatening effects.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say about her new friend Susan?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She shows a real passion for taking photos.", "B) She has just returned from her hometown.", "C) She comes from the city of Cape Town.", "D) She has a truly amazing appearance."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。对话开头，女士提到她在微信上交了个新朋友名叫苏珊，男士问苏珊的家乡是哪里，女士回答是开普敦。因此，答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Her name is Susan and she's from South Africa.' 'It's called Cape Town.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say about Table Mountain?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is as famous as Cape Town.", "B) It has a flat surface at the top.", "C) It is green and free from pollution.", "D) It was named by European settlers."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。女士介绍开普敦时提到这座城市里有一座俯瞰城市的大山被称为桌山，因为它的顶部是平坦的。因此，答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'The mountain is called Table Mountain because it's flat at the top.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the conversation about the woman's friend Susan?
exam_questions.options: ["A) She has British ancestors.", "B) She is of mixed blood.", "C) She grew up in India.", "D) She speaks several languages."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。对话中女士提到苏珊是白人，她的祖先来自英国。因此，答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Susan is white. She says her ancestors were from Britain.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say about rugby in South Africa?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is an extremely violent sport.", "B) It is becoming a national sport.", "C) It is originated in New Zealand.", "D) It is more popular than football."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。对话中女士提到，在南非，橄榄球比足球更受欢迎，可以推断橄榄球正在成为一项全国性运动。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'I think they play football, but it's not as popular as rugby.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman advise the man do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Prepare a study guide.", "B) Consult his advisors.", "C) Go over his notes regularly.", "D) Take stress-relief sessions."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。对话开头，男士抱怨这学期的课业让他很痛苦并咨询女士的建议，女士反问男士是否考虑过准备一份学习指南，这就是女士的建议，故答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Have you considered making a study guide? It's a tool you can make yourself to take the stress out of studying.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the biggest problem the man has with his studies?
exam_questions.options: ["A) His worksheets are terribly messy.", "B) He finds the workload too heavy.", "C) His study folder is badly disorganized.", "D) He has difficulty taking notes quickly."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。对话中男士指出自己的主要问题是学习文件夹里塞满了笔记和活页练习题，而且杂乱无章。因此，答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'My main problem is that my study folder is full of notes and worksheets, and is badly disorganized.'

exam_questions.question_text: What kind of learner does the woman say she is?
exam_questions.options: ["A) A visual learner.", "B) An emotional learner.", "C) An organized learner.", "D) A logical learner."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。对话中女士向男士介绍了不同的学习者，有视觉学习者，逻辑学习者等，她是情感学习者，需要从情感上与信息互联来理解内容。因此，答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'I'm an emotional learner, which means I need to connect to information emotionally to understand it.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman think the man can do with his notes?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Arrange them using color and pictures.", "B) Restructure them in a logical way.", "C) Commit them to memory after class.", "D) Organize them into a well-connected story."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。对话中，女士了解到男士是视觉学习者后，建议他在学习指南中使用彩色编码来整理笔记，或者使用思维导图来展示信息，使其更易懂。由此可知，女士认为男士可以用色彩和图画的形式做笔记。因此，答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Well, I suggest reorganizing your notes using color-coded sections in your study guides, or using idea mapping to lay out the information and make it more quickly accessible.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the passage about the golden rule?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is mainly based on a society's religion.", "B) It is interpreted differently in different times.", "C) It is a code of conduct based on laws and ethics.", "D) It is a moral principle to guide people's behavior."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文开头指出，黄金法则是一种道德原则，它阐释了你应该以你希望自己被对待的方式对待他人。并举例说明要想得到别人的尊重，就必须尊重别人。由此推断，黄金法则是指导人们行为的道德原则。因此，答案为D。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'The golden rule is a moral principle which states that you should treat others the way you want to be treated yourself.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is a notable criticism of the golden rule?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It may lead to misunderstanding despite good intentions.", "B) It assumes that human beings are all good-natured.", "C) It may sometimes produce undesirable outcomes.", "D) It fails to consider the complexity of human relationships."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。短文中提到，对黄金法则的一个值得注意的批评是，当它与法律和道德原则相冲突时，它的应用会导致不良的后果。因此，答案为C。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'A notable criticism of the golden rule is that its application can lead to undesirable outcomes, when it conflicts with laws and ethical principles.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the example of someone breaking the law serve to show?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The golden rule is often in conflict with certain laws and ethical principles.", "B) The golden rule must sometimes give way to more important principles.", "C) Failure to follow the golden rule may lead to violation of laws and ethics.", "D) Observing the golden rule is the first step to becoming a responsible citizen."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文中提到，如果有人违法，按照黄金法则，我们会不计较，因为我们不想让自己受到惩罚。然而大多数人会选择将法律和道德准则置于黄金法则之上，这意味着他们会尽可能地执行黄金法则，只要它不与更重要的概念冲突。因此，答案为B。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'most individuals and societies choose to place laws and ethical principles above the golden rule. This means that they strive to implement the golden rule whenever possible, as long as it doesn't clash with a more important concept.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the current statistics about diversity in large corporations?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Many of them find it rather difficult to manage.", "B) They have not seen as much diversity as desired.", "C) Many of them have an increasingly diversified staff.", "D) They have not quite grasped the concept of diversity."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。短文开头提到，许多大公司在其网站上强调多元化的重要性，但目前的统计数据显示，美国的经理人仍然往往都是白人和男性。显然，实现多元化的愿望并没有在企业中成为现实。因此，答案为B。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'Today, many large corporations stress the importance of diversity on their websites, but current statistics show that the typical manager in America still tends to be white and male. Obviously, the desire to bring about diversity has not translated into corporate reality.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the newly published study focused on?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Initiatives to achieve diversity in large corporations.", "B) Advantages and disadvantages of a diversified team.", "C) People's attitudes towards diversity at the workplace.", "D) Innovative ideas and solutions resulting from diversity."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。短文中提到，巴塞尔大学的一组研究人员发表了一项新研究，该研究与人们对工作中的多元化的态度有关。因此，答案为C。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'A team of researchers from the University of Basel published their new study about people's attitudes towards diversity at work.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do the findings of the new study show?
exam_questions.options: ["A) People prefer to work with team members similar to themselves.", "B) Employers attach great importance to their corporations' diversity.", "C) Employers differ from employees in their perspectives on diversity.", "D) Doubts about the practicability of diversity are gradually disappearing."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文中提到，当人们参与到自己的工作团队时，他们往往更喜欢与自己相似的团队成员。因此，答案为A。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'In other words, when a person's own work group is involved, they tend to prefer team members who are similar to themselves.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is a major key to success in international business according to the passage?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Choosing the best time for signing a business contract.", "B) Changing one's form of communication from time to time.", "C) Laying equal stress on written and spoken communication.", "D) Using different forms of communication appropriately."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文开头提到，交流可分为书面交流和口头交流，人们什么时候需要书面或口头交流取决于他们的文化。知道适时将一种形式换成另一种形式是在国际业务中取得成功的关键。因此，答案为D。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'How the balance is struck between these two forms of communication...Understanding when it's appropriate to exchange one form for another can be a major key to success in international business.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say about spoken word agreements in some Middle East countries?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are regarded as seriously binding.", "B) They are seldom honored by business partners.", "C) They are taken as memos of understanding.", "D) They are to be confirmed in written form."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。短文中提到，在中东部分地区，口头协议被视为具有很强的约束力，一个人的言语与他们的信誉相关，而书面合同则被当作协议备忘录。因此，答案为A。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'In parts of the Middle East, you'll find spoken word agreements are seen as seriously binding. A person's word is linked to their honor, so verbal agreements are seen as important, whereas written contracts are taken as memos of understanding.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the Western working culture?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It has reached the highest level of evolution.", "B) It places a high value on written contracts.", "C) It regards written contracts as unalterable.", "D) It has seen a decline in verbal agreements."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文中提到，西方的工作文化倾向于高度重视书面文字，这在合同方面更为明显。因此，答案为B。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'Western working culture tends to place a high value on the written word, and this reaches its highest level of intensity when it comes to contracts.'

exam_questions.question_text: How does a Japanese firm tend to view a written contract?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Its details cannot be renegotiated.", "B) It has to be carried out to the letter.", "C) It strengthens business partnerships.", "D) Its terms may not be strictly binding."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。短文中提到，有些文化中，书面合同条款可能没有严格的约束力，并举例一家日本公司已经签订了一份合同，但他们可能不会被合同的每一个细节所约束，尤其是在后来情况发生变化的情况下。由此可见，日本公司认为合同条款可能没有严格的约束力。因此，答案为D。
exam_questions.explanation: 短文中提到：'By contrast, other cultures may not see written contracts as quite so binding...For example, a Japanese firm may have signed a contract, but they may not feel bound by every detail of it—particularly if circumstances later change.'

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前有情态动词could，因此本空应填入动词原形。空格所在句的意思是：如果它们在任何情况下都能______不是更好吗？根据上文可知，空格所在句的主语they指的是teeth。结合语境、常识以及备选的动词原形可知，本空应填入含有"咀嚼"意义的动词原形，由此确定答案为C) chew。
exam_questions.explanation: 根据上下文，牙齿作为工具，如果能在任何情况下都能咀嚼食物会更好。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格前有形容词性物主代词our，后面是名词discomfort，因此本空应填入形容词或名词。空格所在句的意思是：尽管我们的______不舒服，事实证明我们的牙齿如此敏感是有原因的。由our teeth are so sensitive可知，discomfort指的是"牙齿"不舒服，因此本空应填入含有"牙齿"意义的形容词或名词，由此确定答案为G) dental。
exam_questions.explanation: dental discomfort表示牙齿不适。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前有不定冠词a，空格后是名词mechanism。mechanism后是that引导的定语从句，用来修饰先行词mechanism。因此，本空应填入形容词或名词来修饰mechanism。空格所在句的意思是：牙痛是一种______机制，确保当牙齿受损时，我们会注意到并采取措施。由此可知，牙痛是一种"防御"机制，因此本空应填入含有"防御"意义的名词，由此确定答案为F) defense。
exam_questions.explanation: defense mechanism表示防御机制。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 语义理解题。空格前是名词tissue，空格后是谓语动词is exposed，因此本空应填入一个定语来修饰名词tissue。空格所在句的意思是：牙齿因为被磨损得太多而导致______组织暴露在外面。结合常识可知，牙齿被磨损得太多之后，"下面的"组织就会暴露在外面，因此本空应填入含有"下面"意义的词，由此确定答案为O) underneath。
exam_questions.explanation: tissue underneath表示下面的组织。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前有情态动词might，因此本空应填入动词原形。空格所在句的意思是：如果牙齿感觉不到疼痛，我们可能会在损害牙齿的情况下______使用它们。上一句已经说明牙痛是一种保护机制，在感到牙痛时我们就不再使用那颗牙齿了。本句是一个假设，即如果牙齿感受不到疼痛，那我们就会"继续"使用牙齿，这样会伤害牙齿。因此，本空应填入含有"继续"意义的动词原形，由此确定答案为E) continue。
exam_questions.explanation: continue to use表示继续使用。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格前是名词，空格后是名词teeth，因此空格处应填入形容词或名词来修饰teeth，和teeth一起作damaging的宾语。空格所在句的意思是：对人类来说，损害______牙齿是一个问题。由常识可知，人的一生总共有乳牙和恒牙两副牙齿。乳牙会被恒牙替换，但是恒牙脱落后不能再生，因此恒牙受损就比较严重了。恒牙就是成熟的牙，因此，本空应填入表达"成熟的"意义的词，由此确定答案为A) adult。
exam_questions.explanation: adult teeth表示恒牙、成人牙齿。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是情态动词can't，因此本空应填入动词原形。空格所在句的意思是：对人类来说，损害成熟的牙齿是一个问题，因为我们不能像鳄鱼那样______它们。由常识可知，损坏成熟的牙齿是一个问题，因为人类无法自然"替换"成熟的牙齿，因此本空应填入含有"替换"意义的动词原形，由此确定答案为L) replace。
exam_questions.explanation: replace表示替换，这里指人类无法像鳄鱼那样替换掉损坏的牙齿。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是句子的主语that layer of the tooth，空格后是宾语both blood vessels and nerves，因此空格处应填入动词的第三人称单数形式作谓语。空格所在句的意思是：牙齿包括三层，只有其中一层——牙齿最内层——会感到疼痛，因为牙齿那一层______血管和神经。由常识可知，牙齿会感到疼痛是因为"含有"神经，因此本空应填入含有"包含，含有"意义的动词，由此确定答案为D) contains。
exam_questions.explanation: contains表示包含、含有。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是名词短语tooth pain，空格后是介词短语by heat or cold，而tooth pain by heat or cold是complain of的宾语。由此可知，空格处应填入动词的-ed形式作pain的后置定语。空格所在句的意思是：牙齿敏感的人可能会抱怨诸如由热或冷______牙痛。由常识可知，对牙齿敏感的人来说，太热或太冷的东西容易引起"牙痛"，因此本空应填入含有"引起"意义的动词-ed形式，由此确定答案为N) triggered。
exam_questions.explanation: triggered by表示由...引发、触发。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adult", "B) associated", "C) chew", "D) contains", "E) continue", "F) defense", "G) dental", "H) downward", "I) emotional", "J) implies", "K) mammal", "L) replace", "M) swallow", "N) triggered", "O) underneath"]
exam_questions.analysis: 语义理解题。空格前是be动词，空格后是介词with，因此本空应填入一个词构成短语be ______with。由前一句可知，牙齿内层的神经不会感受到温度，它们感受到的是"与异常温度有关的"疼痛。因此，空格处应填入含有"有关"意义的词，由此确定答案为B) associated。
exam_questions.explanation: be associated with表示与...有关。

exam_questions.question_text: Clues about the culture of a company can be found on its website.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句提到，你到底应该去哪里寻找这些文化线索呢？首先从最明显的地方开始：公司的网站。题干中的Clues about the culture of a company和its website分别对应定位句中的these culture clues和the company's website。题干是对定位句的概括归纳，故答案为G)。
exam_questions.explanation: G段第四、五句：'And where exactly should you look for these culture clues? Start with the most obvious place first; the company's website.'

exam_questions.question_text: It can be difficult to know the real situation in a company until you become part of it.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句指出，在你实际去某个公司工作之前弄清楚该公司是什么样子可能是个挑战。题干中的difficult对应定位句中的a bit of a challenge，题干中的know the real situation in a company对应定位句中的figuring out what a company is like，题干中的become part of it对应定位句中的actually work there。题干是对定位句的同义转述，故答案为D)。
exam_questions.explanation: D段第一句：'However, figuring out what a company is like before you actually work there can be a bit of a challenge.'

exam_questions.question_text: It is impossible for a job applicant to have every expectation met.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句指出，"我"在一个雇主那里找到所有这些东西的概率有多大？几乎没有——相信"我"，"我"已经找过了。题干中的impossible对应定位句中的Slim to none，题干中的have every expectation met是对定位句中finding all of those things with one employer的同义转述；题干中的a job applicant对应定位句中的I。题干是对定位句的同义转述，故答案为M)。
exam_questions.explanation: M段第一、二句：'What are my chances of finding all of those things with one employer? Slim to none—believe me, I've looked.'

exam_questions.question_text: Simply by reading its description, the author found the job offered ideal.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位段指出，理论上，这份工作对"我"来说似乎很完美。题干中的reading its description对应定位句中的On paper，题干中的the author found the job offered ideal对应定位句中的the job seemed perfect for me。题干是对定位段的归纳总结，故答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: A段第一句：'On paper, the job seemed perfect for me: The position was completely in line with my degree, the duties and responsibilities were compatible with my interests, and the office maintained a well-stocked kitchen that would satisfy my every snack desire.'

exam_questions.question_text: Job applicants are advised to make a written list of their likes and dislikes in their previous employment.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句指出，首先写下你不喜欢前任雇主的地方，以及你真正看重的部分。这里没有错误的答案——所以从大事到小细节，把它们都写在你的清单上。题干中的make a written list对应定位句中的write them all down on your list，题干中的likes and dislikes对应定位句中的the parts you really valued和the things you didn't like，题干中的previous employment对应定位句中的previous employers。题干是对定位句的概括归纳，故答案为F)。
exam_questions.explanation: F段第一、二句：'Start by writing down the things you didn't like about previous employers, as well as the parts you really valued. There's no wrong answer here—so from big things to small details, write them all down on your list.'

exam_questions.question_text: At the end of an interview, a job applicant should seize the opportunity to get answers to their urgent questions.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句指出，你知道在面试结束时，招聘负责人问你有没有什么问题，你只是张着嘴茫然地盯着桌子对面吗？这是一个很好的机会，你可以大声说出自己的想法，让招聘负责人回答你迫切想了解的企业文化的问题！题干中的At the end of an interview对应定位句中的at the end of a job interview，题干中的the opportunity to get answers to their urgent questions对应定位句中的the perfect opportunity和get your burning company culture questions answered。题干是对定位句的概括归纳，故答案为K)。
exam_questions.explanation: K段第二、三句：'You know that part at the end of a job interview when the hiring manager asks if you have any questions, and you just stare across the table blankly with your mouth hanging open? That's the perfect opportunity to speak up and get your burning company culture questions answered!'

exam_questions.question_text: To begin with, job applicants should be clear what they expect from their future employer.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位句指出，在你确定自己和某家公司是否合拍之前，先明确你到底想从雇主那里得到什么，这一点很重要。题干中的be clear对应定位句中的have a solid handle，题干中的what they expect from their future employer对应定位句中的what exactly you want from your employer。题干是对定位句的归纳总结，故答案为E)。
exam_questions.explanation: E段第三句：'So before you can determine whether you and a specific company would be compatible together, it's important to have a solid handle on what exactly you want from your employer.'

exam_questions.question_text: Job applicants should read with a critical eye what is written about a company on the website.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句指出，记住要对你读到的评论持保留态度——其中许多都是由被鄙视的员工写的。题干中的read with a critical eye what is written about a company对应定位句中的take the reviews you read with a grain of salt，故答案为I)。
exam_questions.explanation: I段第二句：'However, remember to take the reviews you read with a grain of salt—many of them are written by scorned employees.'

exam_questions.question_text: Job satisfaction has a lot to do with company culture.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位句指出，公司文化会对你的工作感受产生很大的影响，所以你要确保你是跟真正感兴趣的公司签了聘用函。题干中的Job satisfaction对应定位句中的how you feel about your work，题干中的has a lot to do with对应定位句中的have a big impact on，题干中的company culture在定位句中直接出现，故答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: C段最后一句：'Company culture can have a big impact on how you feel about your work, so you want to make sure you sign an offer letter with an organization you're truly excited about.'

exam_questions.question_text: A chat with an insider of a company can give job applicants very useful information when they prepare for an interview.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位句指出，通过LinkedIn或电子邮件给该公司的在职员工或离职员工发一条简短的信息，询问他们是否愿意和你就该公司的总体情况进行简短的交谈。如果你的聊天请求得到了同意，你将会带着一些非常强大和有用的信息进入面试！题干中的A chat在定位句中直接出现，题干中的an insider of a company对应定位句中的a current or previous company employee，题干中的very useful information对应定位句中的pretty powerful and helpful information。题干是对定位句的总结，故答案为J)。
exam_questions.explanation: J段第二、三句：'Send a quick message to a current or previous company employee on LinkedIn or by email and ask if they would be willing to have a quick conversation with you about the organization in general. If you get a yes to your request for a chat, you'll be armed with some pretty powerful and helpful information heading into your interview!'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author say about students enrolled in online classes?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They can access course materials easily.", "B) They are unmotivated to learn.", "C) They can learn at their own pace.", "D) They rarely fulfil the course requirements."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第二段起到承上启下的作用。第三段指出，学生缺乏学习的欲望，他们只是简单地完成作业以获得及格的分数，而没有真正参与到课程学习中。故正确答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段：'First of all, students lack the desire to learn, and they simply complete their assignments to receive credit for a passing grade rather than genuinely engage with the course material.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think of online course assignments?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are made convenient to mark.", "B) They are meant to facilitate interaction.", "C) They are based on easily accessible material.", "D) They are given to accommodate students' needs."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第四段第二句提到，这些作业不是为了让学生深入研究学习内容而设计的，而是为了便于评分，从而容纳如此大量的学生。故正确答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段第二句：'They are not designed for students to interact with the material in depth but designed to be graded easily to accommodate such a large number of students.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author say is one disadvantage of online classes?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are frequently scheduled at irregular times.", "B) They make professors' offices much less accessible.", "C) They tend to increase professors' burden of responding to students' emails.", "D) They provide little chance for students to build relationships with each other."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位句提到，也许参与在线课程的最大缺点是教师和学生之间缺乏面对面的互动。第六段进一步指出，学生之间的互动也很少，学生很难创建学习小组并与同龄人建立关系。故正确答案为D)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段第一句和第六段：'Perhaps the biggest disadvantage of taking an online class is the absence of face-to-face interaction between the teacher and their students.' 'There is also little interaction amongst students. It can be harder for students to create study groups and form relationships with their peers.'

exam_questions.question_text: What problem may arise if classes go online?
exam_questions.options: ["A) More students may find it easy to be absent from them.", "B) Teachers will worry about poor internet connections.", "C) Some students may have difficulty attending them.", "D) Schools with limited resources will be at a disadvantage."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。第七段第二句指出，并非所有学生都能获得电脑、笔记本和稳定的网络连接，一些学生可能会因为一些原因无法参加线上课程。故正确答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第七段第二句：'Not all students have access to these types of resources, whether it is for financial or other reasons, and some students can be put at a disadvantage.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think constitutes a key part of genuine education?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Acquisition of useful knowledge.", "B) Training of real-life skills on campus.", "C) Development of students' personalities.", "D) Cultivation of analytical thinking ability."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位句提到在线课程强调便利性而不是批判性思维，并不能提供真正的教育。由此可知，D)中提到的"思辨能力的培养"是真正教育的组成部分。故正确答案为D)。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段第二句：'However, they fail to provide a genuine education with an emphasis on convenience rather than critical thinking.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think open debate can do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Help the public to better understand science.", "B) Clear up confusion in the scientific community.", "C) Settle disputes between universities and government agencies.", "D) Prevent information from being used incorrectly by the public."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位句指出，当任何领域的辩论走出了大学和政府机构的大厅时，信息就有可能被误用，导致公共混乱。然而，公开辩论也可以促进科学界和公众之间的交流。由此可知，公开辩论可以帮助公众更好地理解科学，故答案为A)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段第四句：'yet, open debate can also promote communication between the scientific community and the public.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why did a recent debate published in The New York Times arouse concerns among experts?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It might hinder the progress in medical research.", "B) It might breed public distrust in modern medicine.", "C) It might add to the difficulty of getting research funds.", "D) It might prevent medical scientists reaching consensus."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。第二段首句介绍这场辩论，第三句提到一些专家的担心：这种公开的猜测可能会导致人们认为，细节上的分歧意味着对现代医学的安全性和效率缺乏足够的科学共识。由此可以推断，这会引起公众对现代医学不信任，故答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段第三句：'But some experts worried that such public speculation might lead people to believe that disagreement about the details meant a lack of adequate scientific consensus over the safety and efficiency of modern-day medicine.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does the author say some experts' anxiety seems misplaced?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Debating scientific issues at a conference is now old-fashioned.", "B) Diverse topics can be debated by both scientists and the public.", "C) Debates about science are accessible to the public anyway.", "D) Scientists can voice their opinions whatever way they like."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第三段首句指出，这种焦虑似乎放错了地方。末句指出，如今，无论有关科学的辩论发生在哪里，公众都可以接触到，故答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段最后一句：'These days, the public can access debates about science regardless of where they take place.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author suggest scientists do about public debate?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Have more discussions about it.", "B) Embrace it with open arms.", "C) Formulate new rules for it.", "D) Restrain it to a rational degree."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位句提到，对许多科学家来说，公开辩论是一个新的领域，它可能感觉像是一个没有什么限制或规则的地方，但与其避免这样的对话，不如让辩论变得透明和充满活力，无论辩论在哪里举行。由此可以推断，作者支持公开辩论，故答案为B)。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段首句：'For many scientists, public debate is a new frontier and it may feel like a place with few restraints or rules, but rather than avoiding such conversations, let the debates be transparent and vigorous, wherever they are held.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author say about science in the last paragraph?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is transmitted through textbooks.", "B) It is what proves valid and true to life.", "C) It is a dynamic and self-improving process.", "D) It is a collection of facts and established rules."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。最后一段第二句提到，如果公众要理解科学是一个正大光明的自我纠正的过程，那么，需要摒弃那种认为科学是教科书中一系列固定不变的事实的观点。由此可以推断，科学是一个自我完善的过程，故答案为C)。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段第二句：'If the public is to understand that science is an honorably self-correcting process, the idea that science is a fixed set of facts in a textbook needs to be dismissed.'

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.analysis: 翻译题目，需要学生将中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法、词汇和句式结构的正确性
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的汉译英能力，包括词汇选择、语法结构、句式转换和语言表达的准确性
